thread.title: China’s Approach to 2022 Winter Olympics: Faster, Higher, Stronger, Cheaper

author: Dominique Fong
title: China’s Approach to 2022 Winter Olympics: Faster, Higher, Stronger, Cheaper
text:
CHONGLI, China—A decade ago, China pulled out all the stops in an effort to dazzle the world for the Beijing Summer Olympics, spending an estimated $42 billion and building showcase projects such as the “Bird’s Nest” stadium that sits mostly empty now.
But the government is taking a different approach in advance of the 2022 Winter Olympics. In this town about a three-hour drive from Beijing that will host the main skiing and snowboarding events, the vision is relatively modest: lift the region’s economy in a sustainable way.
...
